702752f-b.title: Brooklyn: 41st Street - 3rd Avenue
702752f-b.text:
41st Street (right) west of Third Ave. Also shown is Second Ave.
(center of view) between 42nd Street (left)and 41st Street (right).
In the foreground will be erected a two story building for the Shipley
Construction and Supply Company. At the foot of 4lst Street is Pier
No. 7; and at the center right, sectionally shown, are several Bush
Terminal Buildings. In the background, steepled, is the National Meter
Co. Building formerly the National Metal Co. This is a set of two views.
1919.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

702298f.title: Brooklyn: 3rd Avenue - 41st Street
702298f.text:
3rd Avenue, at 41st Street, showing the B. M. T. elevated
station thereon, the view being west on 41st Street.
September 8, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

702751f-a.title: Brooklyn: 41st Street - 3rd Avenue
702751f-a.text:
41st Street, north side, east from Third Avenue. A very old
frame dwelling can be seen nestling against the two-story brick
homes. On the right is Public School No. 136.
September 8, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
